SEARCH
Package Model

Class IssueOrderPhase

java.lang.Object
Model.Phase
Model.IssueOrderPhase
public class IssueOrderPhase extends Phase
Represents the Issue Order Phase of the game. In this phase, players issue orders such as deploy, advance, or use cards. This phase continues until all players have issued their orders.
Author:
Shrey Hingu

  • Method Details

    • initPhase

      public void initPhase()
      Initializes the issue order phase and continuously processes player orders while the current phase is IssueOrderPhase.
      Specified by:
      initPhase in class Phase

    • cardHandle

      protected void cardHandle(String p_inputCommand, Player p_player)
      Handles execution of a card-based command (e.g., bomb, blockade, airlift, negotiate) for the given player. If the player owns the specified card, the command is executed and the result is logged.
      Specified by:
      cardHandle in class Phase
      Parameters:
      p_inputCommand - the full card command entered by the player.
      p_player - the player issuing the card command.

    • loadMap

      protected void loadMap(CommandHandler lCommandHandler) throws CommandValidationException
      Invalid command in Issue Order Phase. Loading a map is only allowed during the Startup Phase before the game begins.
      Specified by:
      loadMap in class Phase
      Parameters:
      lCommandHandler - the command handler containing the map loading command
      Throws:
      CommandValidationException - always thrown to indicate the command is invalid in this phase

    • issueOrder

      private void issueOrder() throws Exception
      Iterates through all players in the game and allows each player to issue orders one at a time if they have more orders to issue. Neutral players are skipped.
      Throws:
      Exception - if an error occurs while players issue orders

    • askForOrders

      public void askForOrders(Player p_player) throws Exception
      Prompts a specific player to enter an order via command line.
      Parameters:
      p_player - the player issuing the order
      Throws:
      Exception - if an error occurs while reading input or processing the command
